He stuck a needle in to get some fluid which he did and it was clear.  I have to go back in 3 weeks to see if it's still there.  It really scared the HELL out of me.  I was a freak for 5 days.  Thanks for the response. :-)

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2008 07:28PM SJacques wrote: Hi All,  I was just diagnosed after the new year.  I was told the week of Christmas I had microcalsication on my mamogram and had to go through a biopsy which came back inconclusive.  Sent my stuff to the mayo clinic for another opion. Waited through Christams and New years to get my results. IT FREEKED ME OUT.  Then had my first surgery on Jan 7th had to go through the needle localization.  It came to be that I had DCIS non invasive Stage 0.  Had another surgery on the 25th of March for larger margins.  My fear is the radiation that I have to go through.  Can anyone help me with this.  I have to have 31 treatments and have had 9 already I am afraid it is going to do bad things to me.  Has anyone been through this?  I have anxiety and can't sleep.
